intro: Rapanea taomensis, commonly known as the Taomean evergreen, is a flowering plant native to the island of Taohu in the South China Sea. It belongs to the family Lauraceae, which includes laurels and cinnamon trees. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruits are spherical, woody capsules that contain small, dark seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Rapanea taomensis is considered a rare and endangered species.
